posts.post_content:
These are the reasons why I love this card...  
  
1) It is BIG! Really really BIG! Bigger than [THAT](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=2525)!  
2) It tramples.  
3) It costs ONE GENERIC MANA.  
4) It has a specific drawback, and I love the old fatties with drawback! Moreover, the drawback was already [bypassable](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=315) when it came out.  
5) It is Phyrexian.  
6) It is a gargantuan insect-like machine that is about to devour a mage trying to stop it with a ridiculous spell.  
7) It creates LOTS of BIG effects. I post here some of them sorted by mana cost.  
- For ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol) you have a 12/12 trampler ([Torpor Orb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Torpor Orb) or [Illusionary Mask](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Illusionary Mask))  
- For ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol) you deal 12 damage to any target ([Pandemonium](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pandemonium) or [Warstorm Surge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Warstorm Surge))  
- For ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol) you have a 12/12 trampler ([Sundial of the Infinite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sundial of the Infinite))  
- For ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) you have a 12/12 trampler ([Stifle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stifle))  
- For ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) you deal 12 damage to a play... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
These are the reasons why I love this card...

1) It is BIG! Really really BIG! Bigger than THAT!
2) It tramples.
3) It costs ONE GENERIC MANA.
4) It has a specific drawback, and I love the old fatties with drawback! Moreover, the drawback was already bypassable when it came out.
5) It is Phyrexian.
6) It is a gargantuan insect-like machine that is about to devour a mage trying to stop it with a ridiculous spell.
7) It creates LOTS of BIG effects. I post here some of them sorted by mana cost.
- For you have a 12/12 trampler (Torpor Orb or Illusionary Mask)
- For you deal 12 damage to any target (Pandemonium or Warstorm Surge)
- For you have a 12/12 trampler (Sundial of the Infinite)
- For you have a 12/12 trampler (Stifle)
- For you deal 12 damage to a play... (see all)

posts.post_content:
Strange to think of anything Phyrexian working for the [Greater Good](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Greater Good).  
  
(That might be the best card draw engine in the game of Magic, actually. I can't think of any other "draw 12" spells for ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) or even ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol), and this guy's triggered ability uses the stack, so it works. It's even repeatable if (1) you can bounce the Dreadnought from your graveyard to your hand and (b) you need 24 cards. Sheeeesh.)  
  
@ redgolem -- yes, but only if you are allowed to cast Phyrexian Dreadnought at instant speed. The enters-play ability resolves before you are able to cast any non-instant-speed spells, such as a second Dreadnought. To use your trick would require giving the Dreadnought flash, or something like [Aluren](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aluren).
posts.html:
Strange to think of anything Phyrexian working for the Greater Good.

(That might be the best card draw engine in the game of Magic, actually. I can't think of any other "draw 12" spells for or even , and this guy's triggered ability uses the stack, so it works. It's even repeatable if (1) you can bounce the Dreadnought from your graveyard to your hand and (b) you need 24 cards. Sheeeesh.)

@ redgolem -- yes, but only if you are allowed to cast Phyrexian Dreadnought at instant speed. The enters-play ability resolves before you are able to cast any non-instant-speed spells, such as a second Dreadnought. To use your trick would require giving the Dreadnought flash, or something like Aluren.

posts.post_content: An interesting card back in the day, far more powerful now with so many ways to bypass the drawback. What I find interesting is that the Dreadnaught does NOT sacrifice itself if you fail to meet the conditions - instead, it just destroys itself without possibility of regeneration. It's not really important given all the other ways around it's drawback, but it's just an odd example of how cards worked back then.
posts.html:
An interesting card back in the day, far more powerful now with so many ways to bypass the drawback. What I find interesting is that the Dreadnaught does NOT sacrifice itself if you fail to meet the conditions - instead, it just destroys itself without possibility of regeneration. It's not really important given all the other ways around it's drawback, but it's just an odd example of how cards worked back then.

posts.post_content:
Turn 1)  
 Play Swamp  
 Cast [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual)  
 Cast [Torpor Orb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Torpor Orb)  
 Cast [Phyrexian Dreadnought](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Dreadnought)  
  
Turn 2)  
 Play Mountain  
 Attack for 12.  
 Cast [Fling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fling).  
  
Game Over.  
  
Also works with [Sundial of the Infinite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sundial of the Infinite)  
- Dreadnought hits the battlefield. Ability triggers. The turn ends - all abilities on the stack are exiled -
posts.html:
Turn 1)

Cast Torpor Orb
Cast Phyrexian Dreadnought

Turn 2)

Cast Fling.

Game Over.

Also works with Sundial of the Infinite
- Dreadnought hits the battlefield. Ability triggers. The turn ends - all abilities on the stack are exiled -
